title: Contact page text color adjustments (white contact info, black form text)

requirements.summary: Make the Contact Information section render entirely in white text while leaving the Contact page header unchanged and keeping links functional.
acceptanceCriteria: On /contact, the "Contact Information" card’s heading text and all contact info labels/values (Email, Location, WhatsApp) display in white.
The Email and WhatsApp remain clickable links and still work (mailto link for email; wa.me link for WhatsApp).
The Contact page header ("Get In Touch" and its subtitle) remains as it currently appears (no color/style changes).

file_operations.description: Update the Contact Information section wrapper styles to enforce white text for headings, labels, values, and links (replacing the current black text override). Keep the page header section exactly as-is, and ensure the Email (mailto:) and WhatsApp (wa.me) anchors remain unchanged and clickable. Use shadcn-ui styling via className overrides only (do not edit immutable ui sources). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Adjust the Contact form UI to use black text throughout the form area (title/description, labels, and typed input/textarea text) while preserving validation and submit status behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: On /contact, the contact form’s title/description and all field labels render in black.
Text typed into the Name/Email/Subject inputs and Message textarea renders in black.
Form validation errors and submit success/error status messages still appear correctly and remain readable.
No changes are made to the backend submission behavior; the form still submits as before.

file_operations.description: Update shadcn-ui Card/CardHeader/CardTitle/CardDescription/Label usage to render black text (remove current text-white classes) and add className overrides so Input/Textarea user-entered text renders black as well (without changing validation logic or submission flow). Ensure error messages and SubmitStatus remain readable on the white/light form background. Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui; achieve changes via props/className overrides only. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
